an5.209:1.1: “Mendicants, there are these five drawbacks in reciting with a drawn-out singing voice.
an5.209:1.3: You relish the sound of your own voice. Others relish the sound of your voice. Householders complain:
an5.209:1.4: ‘These ascetics, followers of the Sakyan, sing just like us!’ When you’re enjoying the melody, your immersion breaks up. Those who come after follow your example.
an5.209:1.5: These are the five drawbacks in reciting with a drawn-out singing voice.”
